text: When the avenger of blood comes after him, they must not hand over to him the one who committed manslaughter, for he accidentally killed his fellow man without premeditation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must remain in that city until his case is decided by the assembly, and the high priest dies. Then the one who committed manslaughter may return home to the city from which he escaped.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they selected Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beyond the Jordan east of Jericho they selected Bezer in the wilderness on the plain belonging to the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead belonging to the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan belonging to the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the cities of refuge appointed for all the Israelites and for resident foreigners living among them. Anyone who accidentally killed someone could escape there and not be executed by the avenger of blood, at least until his case was reviewed by the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal leaders of the Levites went before Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun and the Israelite tribal leaders
speaker: Narrator

text: in Shiloh in the land of Canaan and said, “The Lord told Moses to assign us cities in which to live along with the grazing areas for our cattle.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites assigned these cities and their grazing areas to the Levites from their own holdings, as the Lord had instructed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first lot belonged to the Kohathite clans. The Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest were allotted thirteen cities from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten cities from the clans of the tribe of Ephraim, and from the tribe of Dan and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gershon’s descendants were allotted thirteen cities from the clans of the tribe of Issachar, and from the tribes of Asher and Naphtali and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Merari’s descendants by their clans were allotted twelve cities from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites assigned to the Levites by lot these cities and their grazing areas, as the Lord had instructed Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assigned from the tribes of Judah and Simeon the cities listed below.
speaker: Narrator

text: (They were assigned to the Kohathite clans of the Levites who were descendants of Aaron, for the first lot fell to them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They assigned them Kiriath Arba (Arba was the father of Anak), that is, Hebron, in the hill country of Judah, along with its surrounding grazing areas.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the city’s fields and surrounding towns they had assigned to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his property.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So to the descendants of Aaron the priest they assigned Hebron (a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter), Libnah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jattir, Eshtemoa,
speaker: Narrator

text: Holon, Debir,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain, Juttah, and Beth Shemesh, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of nine cities taken from these two tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Benjamin they assigned Gibeon, Geba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth, and Almon, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests descended from Aaron received thirteen cities and their grazing areas.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the Kohathite clans of the Levites were allotted cities from the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assigned them Shechem (a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter) in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kibzaim, and Beth Horon, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Dan they assigned Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon, and Gath Rimmon, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh they assigned Taanach and Gath Rimmon, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the Kohathite clans received ten cities and their grazing areas.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assigned to the Gershonite clans of the Levites the following cities: from the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan (a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter) and Beeshtarah, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of two cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Issachar: Kishon, Daberath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth, and En Gannim, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Asher: Mishal, Abdon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Helkath, and Rehob, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee (a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter), Hammoth Dor, and Kartan, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of three cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gershonite clans received thirteen cities and their grazing areas.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assigned to the Merarite clans (the remaining Levites) the following cities: from the tribe of Zebulun: Jokneam, Kartah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dimnah, and Nahalal, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Reuben: Bezer, Jahaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth, and Mephaath, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead (a city of refuge for one who committed manslaughter), Mahanaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon, and Jazer, along with the grazing areas of each—a total of four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Merarite clans (the remaining Levites) were allotted twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites received within the land owned by the Israelites forty-eight cities in all and their grazing areas.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of these cities had grazing areas around it; they were alike in this regard.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord gave Israel all the land he had solemnly promised to their ancestors, and they conquered it and lived in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord made them secure, in fulfillment of all he had solemnly promised their ancestors. None of their enemies could resist them. The Lord handed all their enemies over to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not one of the Lord’s faithful promises to the family of Israel was left unfulfilled; every one was realized.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh
speaker: Narrator

text: and told them: “You have carried out all the instructions of Moses the Lord’s servant, and you have obeyed all I have told you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not abandoned your fellow Israelites this entire time, right up to this very day. You have completed the task given you by the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Lord your God has made your fellow Israelites secure, just as he promised them. So now you may turn around and go to your homes in your own land that Moses the Lord’s servant assigned to you east of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But carefully obey the commands and instructions Moses the Lord’s servant gave you. Love the Lord your God, follow all his instructions, obey his commands, be loyal to him, and serve him with all your heart and being!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua rewarded them and sent them on their way; they returned to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now to one half-tribe of Manasseh, Moses had assigned land in Bashan; and to the other half Joshua had assigned land on the west side of the Jordan with their fellow Israelites.) When Joshua sent them home, he rewarded them,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Take home great wealth, a lot of cattle, silver, gold, bronze, iron, and a lot of clothing. Divide up the goods captured from your enemies with your brothers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites in Shiloh in the land of Canaan and headed home to their own land in Gilead, which they acquired by the Lord’s command through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh came to Geliloth near the Jordan in the land of Canaan and built there, near the Jordan, an impressive altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites received this report: “Look, the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar at the entrance to the land of Canaan, at Geliloth near the Jordan on the Israelite side.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Israelites heard this, the entire Israelite community assembled at Shiloh to launch an attack against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites sent Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, to the land of Gilead to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was accompanied by ten leaders, one from each of the Israelite tribes, each one a family leader among the Israelite clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to the land of Gilead to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and said to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The entire community of the Lord says, ‘Why have you disobeyed the God of Israel by turning back today from following the Lord? You built an altar for yourselves and have rebelled today against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sin we committed at Peor was bad enough. To this very day we have not purified ourselves; it even brought a plague on the community of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now today you dare to turn back from following the Lord! You are rebelling today against the Lord; tomorrow he may break out in anger against the entire community of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if your own land is impure, cross over to the Lord’s own land, where the Lord himself lives, and settle down among us. But don’t rebel against the Lord or us by building for yourselves an altar other than the altar of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Achan son of Zerah disobeyed the command about the city’s riches, the entire Israelite community was judged, though only one man had sinned. He most certainly died for his sin!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered the leaders of the Israelite clans:
speaker: Narrator

text: “El, God, the Lord! El, God, the Lord! He knows the truth! Israel must also know! If we have rebelled or disobeyed the Lord, don’t spare us today!
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have built an altar for ourselves to turn back from following the Lord by making burnt sacrifices and grain offerings on it, or by offering tokens of peace on it, the Lord himself will punish us.
speaker: Narrator

text: We swear we have done this because we were worried that in the future your descendants would say to our descendants, ‘What relationship do you have with the Lord God of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord made the Jordan a boundary between us and you Reubenites and Gadites. You have no right to worship the Lord.’ In this way your descendants might cause our descendants to stop obeying the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we decided to build this altar, not for burnt offerings and sacrifices,
speaker: Narrator

text: but as a reminder to us and you and our descendants who follow us, that we will honor the Lord in his very presence with burnt offerings, sacrifices, and tokens of peace. Then in the future your descendants will not be able to say to our descendants, ‘You have no right to worship the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: We said, ‘If in the future they say such a thing to us or to our descendants, we will reply, “See the model of the Lord’s altar that our ancestors made, not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a reminder to us and you.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Far be it from us to rebel against the Lord by turning back today from following after the Lord by building an altar for burnt offerings, sacrifices, and tokens of peace aside from the altar of the Lord our God located in front of his dwelling place!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Phinehas the priest and the community leaders and Israel’s clan leaders who accompanied him heard the defense of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassehites, they were satisfied.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassehites, “Today we know that the Lord is among us, because you have not disobeyed the Lord in this. Now you have rescued the Israelites from the Lord’s judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, and the leaders left the Reubenites and Gadites in the land of Gilead and reported back to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites were satisfied with their report and gave thanks to God. They said nothing more about launching an attack to destroy the land in which the Reubenites and Gadites lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites and Gadites named the altar, “Surely it is a Reminder to us that the Lord is God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A long time passed after the Lord made Israel secure from all their enemies, and Joshua was very old.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua summoned all Israel, including the elders, rulers, judges, and leaders, and told them: “I am very old.
speaker: Narrator

text: You saw everything the Lord your God did to all these nations on your behalf, for the Lord your God fights for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have parceled out to your tribes these remaining nations, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west, including all the nations I defeated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God will drive them out from before you and remove them, so you can occupy their land as the Lord your God promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be very strong! Carefully obey all that is written in the law scroll of Moses so you won’t swerve from it to the right or the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: or associate with these nations that remain near you. You must not invoke or make solemn declarations by the names of their gods! You must not worship or bow down to them!
speaker: Narrator

text: But you must be loyal to the Lord your God, as you have been to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The Lord drove out from before you great and mighty nations; no one has been able to resist you to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of you makes a thousand run away, for the Lord your God fights for you, as he promised you he would.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch yourselves carefully! Love the Lord your God!
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you ever turn away and make alliances with these nations that remain near you, and intermarry with them and establish friendly relations with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: know for certain that the Lord your God will no longer drive out these nations from before you. They will trap and ensnare you; they will be a whip that tears your sides and thorns that blind your eyes until you disappear from this good land the Lord your God gave you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Look, today I am about to die. You know with all your heart and being that not even one of all the faithful promises the Lord your God made to you is left unfulfilled; every one was realized—not one promise is unfulfilled!
speaker: Narrator

text: But in the same way every faithful promise the Lord your God made to you has been realized, it is just as certain that if you disobey, then the Lord will bring on you every judgment until he destroys you from this good land that the Lord your God gave you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you violate the covenantal laws of the Lord your God which he commanded you to keep, and follow, worship, and bow down to other gods, then the Lord will be very angry with you and you will disappear quickly from the good land that he gave to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua assembled all the Israelite tribes at Shechem. He summoned Israel’s elders, rulers, judges, and leaders, and they appeared before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua told all the people, “This is what the Lord God of Israel has said: ‘In the distant past your ancestors lived beyond the Euphrates River, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor. They worshiped other gods,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I took your father Abraham from beyond the Euphrates and brought him into the entire land of Canaan. I made his descendants numerous; I gave him Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. To Esau I assigned Mount Seir, while Jacob and his sons went down to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent Moses and Aaron, and I struck Egypt down when I intervened in their land. Then I brought you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I brought your fathers out of Egypt, you arrived at the sea. The Egyptians chased your fathers with chariots and horsemen to the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers cried out for help to the Lord; he made the area between you and the Egyptians dark, and then he drowned them in the sea. You witnessed with your very own eyes what I did in Egypt. You lived in the wilderness for a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived east of the Jordan. They fought with you, but I handed them over to you; you conquered their land, and I destroyed them from before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, launched an attack against Israel. He summoned Balaam son of Beor to call down judgment on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I refused to respond to Balaam; he kept prophesying good things about you, and I rescued you from his power.
speaker: Narrator

text: You crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The leaders of Jericho, as well as the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites, fought with you, but I handed them over to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent terror ahead of you to drive out before you the two Amorite kings. I gave you the victory; it was not by your swords or bows.
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave you a land in which you had not worked hard; you took up residence in cities you did not build, and you are eating the produce of vineyards and olive groves you did not plant.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now obey the Lord and worship him with integrity and loyalty. Put aside the gods your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have no desire to worship the Lord, then choose today whom you will worship, whether it be the gods whom your ancestors worshiped beyond the Euphrates, or the gods of the Amorites in whose land you are living. But I and my family will worship the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people responded, “Far be it from us to abandon the Lord so we can worship other gods!
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord our God took us and our fathers out of slavery in the land of Egypt and performed these awesome miracles before our very eyes. He continually protected us as we traveled and when we passed through nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord drove out from before us all the nations, including the Amorites who lived in the land. So we too will worship the Lord, for he is our God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua warned the people, “You will not keep worshiping the Lord, for he is a holy God. He is a jealous God who will not forgive your rebellion or your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you abandon the Lord and worship foreign gods, he will turn against you; he will bring disaster on you and destroy you, though he once treated you well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to Joshua, “No! We really will worship the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to the people, “Do you agree to be witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to worship the Lord?” They replied, “We are witnesses!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “Now put aside the foreign gods that are among you and submit to the Lord God of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people said to Joshua, “We will worship the Lord our God and obey him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That day Joshua drew up an agreement for the people, and he established rules and regulations for them in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua wrote these words in the Law Scroll of God. He then took a large stone and set it up there under the oak tree near the Lord’s sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to all the people, “Look, this stone will be a witness against us, for it has heard everything the Lord said to us. It will be a witness against you if you deny your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua dismissed the people, they went to their allotted portions of land.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all this Joshua son of Nun, the Lord’s servant, died at the age of 110.
speaker: Narrator

text: They buried him in his allotted territory in Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel worshiped the Lord throughout Joshua’s lifetime and as long as the elderly men who outlived him remained alive. These men had experienced firsthand everything the Lord had done for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the part of the field that Jacob bought from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem, for 100 pieces of money. So it became the inheritance of the tribe of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar son of Aaron died, and they buried him in Gibeah in the hill country of Ephraim, where his son Phinehas had been assigned land.
speaker: Narrator
